snippet: A college entrance exam that is a "certainty like death" for millions of Indians could soon be replaced.
abstract: A college entrance exam that is a "certainty like death" for millions of Indians could soon be replaced.
lead_paragraph: "The Joint Entrance Exam of the Indian Institutes of Technology is a brooding cultural force that is visible across the nation, on signboards and newspaper advertisements, as "I.I.T.-J.E.E.," the first abbreviation many Indian children learn, " Manu Joseph writes in the International Herald Tribune.

headline.main: Rethinking the Mother of All Exams
